p: Infections with Listeria in the neonatal period are described as severe, infrequent, and often associated with hepatic abscess formation. Predisposing factors include prematurity and in older children immunosuppression, diabetes mellitus, and cirrhosis. Treatment of infection is with ampicillin and gentamicin while a vaccine against the organism is being developed for use in immunocompromised hosts [ 5].
